thread.title: Hot Toys Teases Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 Figures
thread.title_full: Hot Toys Teases Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 Figures

author: Kofi Outlaw
title: Hot Toys Teases Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 Figures

organizations.name: marvel cinematic universe yet / chris pratt raves about guardians vol

text:
Hot Toys Teases Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 Figures Kofi Outlaw Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of 
Marvel is set to have a big year in 2017, with three big tentpole films hitting theaters: Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2, Spider-Man: Homecoming and Thor: Ragnarok . 
With those new Marvel Cinematic Universe entries we also get great new Marvel movie merchandise, including the latest from Hot Toys , which always unveils some of the best and most anticipated collectibles fans can get their hands on. 
Since Guardians of the Galaxy vol. 2 arrives first, Hot Toys has begun giving fans a taste of what its tie-in line for the film will look like. Check out this first teaser from the company's Facebook Page: 
The articulation and molding on the individual Guardians members looks on point, the new costumes and body details (like Drax's tattoos or Rocket's fur) seem finely crafted, and there are definitely enough new costume tweaks to make these actually worth adding to collection. 
...But let's be honest: they got our money as soon as we saw that adorable Baby Groot! 
SYNOPSIS: Set to the backdrop of ‘Awesome Mixtape #2,’ Marvel’s Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 continues the team’s adventures as they traverse the outer reaches of the cosmos. The Guardians must fight to keep their newfound family together as they unravel the mysteries of Peter Quill’s true parentage. Old foes become new allies and fan-favorite characters from the classic comics will come to our heroes’ aid as the Marvel cinematic universe continues to expand. 
MORE GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY VOL. 2: GotGv2 Tops Most Anticipated of 2017 list / Guardians Of The Galaxy 2017 Toy Line-Up Revealed By Hasbro / Jennifer Lawrence Wants Mystique In Guardians Of The Galaxy / 5 Awesome Guardians Who Aren't In The Marvel Cinematic Universe Yet / Chris Pratt Raves About Guardians Vol. 2 / Jennifer Lawrence Reacts To Being Fan Cast As She-Groot / Chris Pratt Asks Jennifer Lawrence "How Does It Feel Being In The Stupidest Marvel Movie / Director Addresses If Nova Will Show Up / Alan Tudyk Wants To Join Guardians Vol. 2 
Doctor Strange is in theaters now; Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 – May 5, 2017; Spider-Man: Homecoming – July 7, 2017; Thor: Ragnarok – November 3, 2017; Black Panther – February 16, 2018; Avengers: Infinity War – May 4, 2018; Ant-Man and the Wasp – July 6, 2018; and Captain Marvel on March 8, 2019.
